channel.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
channel.description:
What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
I finally figured out the formula info. to make it close to normal as possible and I just wanted to know if anyone knew the exact EXP you get for killing a chicken in RSC so I could make my RSC private server as close to the real deal as possible!
I know in RS2 you get 12 EXP for killing a chicken, but in RS2 chickens are lv. 1 not lv. 3 like in RSC
Thanks for any info. you guys can provide on this.

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @i_own_you21 i own you21
item.description:
@i_own_you21 wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:16, topic:236757”]Zian: Okay, I will do that… You know there are four different skills (Attack, Defence, Strength and Hits), right?

You can get experience to all of these skills, or to two of them (at any given time). The different combinations are shown below:

  1. Attack (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  2. Defence (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  3. Strength (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  4. Controlled: Attack (1/4), Defence (1/4), Strength (1/4) and Hits (1/4)

So, as you can see, you need to divide by 4 to have the base-experience.

Take for instance the Chicken you were talking about…

Chicken is level 3, whereas the total experience will become “(3 * 2) + 20”, which equals to 26. Now I guess, 26 isn’t really what you expected, is it? But if you divide this number (26) by 4, you will have a base-experience of “6.5”.

Now you can apply the base-experience differently, depending on what you are training… The following are the only possabilities you have:

  1. Attack (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  2. Defence (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  3. Strength (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  4. Controlled: Attack (6.5), Defence (6.5), Strength (6.5) and Hits (6.5)

This is all information I can give, I am afraid (as there really is no more), so I hope you can work it out from there.

Also, NOTE: You do only get experience after you have killed the NPC, not by every hit. I don’t know where you got that impression from, by reading my message. Now you know that, atleast.[/quote]
he got it from RS2

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Zian: Okay, I will do that… You know there are four different skills (Attack, Defence, Strength and Hits), right?

You can get experience to all of these skills, or to two of them (at any given time). The different combinations are shown below:

  1. Attack (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  2. Defence (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  3. Strength (3/4) and Hits (1/4)
  4. Controlled: Attack (1/4), Defence (1/4), Strength (1/4) and Hits (1/4)

So, as you can see, you need to divide by 4 to have the base-experience.

Take for instance the Chicken you were talking about…

Chicken is level 3, whereas the total experience will become “(3 * 2) + 20”, which equals to 26. Now I guess, 26 isn’t really what you expected, is it? But if you divide this number (26) by 4, you will have a base-experience of “6.5”.

Now you can apply the base-experience differently, depending on what you are training… The following are the only possabilities you have:

  1. Attack (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  2. Defence (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  3. Strength (19.5) and Hits (6.5)
  4. Controlled: Attack (6.5), Defence (6.5), Strength (6.5) and Hits (6.5)

This is all information I can give, I am afraid (as there really is no more), so I hope you can work it out from there.

Also, NOTE: You do only get experience after you have killed the NPC, not by every hit. I don’t know where you got that impression from, by reading my message. Now you know that, atleast.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:13, topic:236757”]Zian: You do not get 8 experience by killing a Chicken in any way, shape or form. If the formula is inaccurate for Chickens, then it is obviously inaccurate for any other NPC aswell, unless the level of an NPC is 6. (6 * 2) + 20 = 32, which when divided by 4, will become 8.

So, instead, just use my formula… Then you don’t have to try finding a formula yourself, which, if you would find it, would be exactly as mine anyway.[/quote]

Explain to me how you get divide by 4? where did that come from? and no with my formula you do get 8 EXP when the chicken dies… are you suppose to get more EXP for each attack you do to it? because even with the unedited source I did not get EXP for each successful attack I only got EXP once the chicken had died.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

@Berky-Scape wrote:

If you attak the chicken you gain 5 xp and if he die you gain 10 cuz he got just 2 hp

item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Zian: You do not get 8 experience by killing a Chicken in any way, shape or form. If the formula is inaccurate for Chickens, then it is obviously inaccurate for any other NPC aswell, unless the level of an NPC is 6. (6 * 2) + 20 = 32, which when divided by 4, will become 8.

So, instead, just use my formula… Then you don’t have to try finding a formula yourself, which, if you would find it, would be exactly as mine anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:11, topic:236757”][quote author=Zian link=topic=312511.msg2491517#msg2491517 date=1224143029]

The exact formula for any NPC in RSC is the following (the formula I added to Geminus):

(Comabat Level * 2) + 20

And yes, for killing a Chicken, it is 19.5. I get that by using my formula aswell. Here is how to calculate it.

A Chicken is level 3, so the formula for a Chicken would be the following:

(3 * 2) + 20

If you know math, you can see that it will end up to 26 pretty fast. 26 is the total experience for a Chicken. But that also includes Hits. So what you have to do, is the following:

Hits = 26 / 4, which is 6.5.

There are two options for the other skills (Attack, Defence and Strength), namely, the skill, or controlled…

Controlled mode: The experience = 26 / 4, which is 6.5.
The skill mode: The experience = (26 / 4) * 3, which is 19.5.

Also, don’t ask whether this formula is accurate, or not, because it is totally accurate (I did check against the real RSC when I developed Geminus).

Zian: Your formula is very redundant… Why do you use “getCombatLevel() * 0” anyway? This will always end up 0, so removing it would never make any difference. Also, if you only keep it at “10 * 0.8”, then it will always become 8. So really, I don’t see what is so good about this formula? It is everything but close to the real RSC-formula.

Yea sort of all ready figured out the formula, and how to make it give the EXP I wanted… that is why I asked how much EXP a chicken normally gave, that way I would have a low lv. monster to base the EXP off of. and most noob RSC players could even answer that question.
[/quote]

In that case, then why did you even give out a formula in a few posts above this one?[/quote]

I gave it out so if others wanted the same RSC EXP rates they could use it, I realize my formula might not be 100% right but it is based off the idea you get 8 EXP for each chicken you kill. I have not had time to test the EXP rates with other monsters yet, so like I said I don’t know if my formula is 100% right.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

Zian: Your formula is very redundant… Why do you use “getCombatLevel() * 0” anyway? This will always end up 0, so removing it would never make any difference. Also, if you only keep it at “10 * 0.8”, then it will always become 8. So really, I don’t see what is so good about this formula? It is everything but close to the real RSC-formula.
[/quote]

@system wrote:

The exact formula for any NPC in RSC is the following (the formula I added to Geminus):

(Comabat Level * 2) + 20

And yes, for killing a Chicken, it is 19.5. I get that by using my formula aswell. Here is how to calculate it.

A Chicken is level 3, so the formula for a Chicken would be the following:

(3 * 2) + 20

If you know math, you can see that it will end up to 26 pretty fast. 26 is the total experience for a Chicken. But that also includes Hits. So what you have to do, is the following:

Hits = 26 / 4, which is 6.5.

There are two options for the other skills (Attack, Defence and Strength), namely, the skill, or controlled…

item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:5, topic:236757”]Ok.

A weird thing.

I went to investigate this for you, via sts i ran my char and found:

Fighting with the setting on STR +3

I killed one chicken it gave 19xp

I killed 1 more and it gave me 20 xp

Then 1 more 19xp

Then 1 more 20 xp.

So i’m not too sure exactly what was going on but you can base it on one of the two.[/quote]

The reason you got 19 EXP and 20 EXP after getting 19 EXP is because you can get .5 EXP but it does not show .XXX EXP but it is possible to get EXP in the decimals.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?

item.title: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

Thanks, now I have the exact EXP scale RSC used.

If any one else wants to change their EXP rates to the exact match of RSC here is what you do.

Go to your server folder then search for “FightEvent.java” open FightEvent.java with notepad or notepad++

change to:

int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 0) + 10) * .8);

Go to your server folder then search for “Player.java” open Player.java with notepad or notepad++

change to:

private double premiumMultiplier = 1.0;

Read full topic
item.source: What was the exp for killing a chicken on RSC?
